caption: Delicious

If you are visiting the city and want to enjoy a relaxed colorful atmosphere full of vegetation Flora and fauna is your choice, its menu is small but covers all kinds of palates, vegans etc. Delicious cocktails await you.
Service was poor. Food was fairly good, although some of it was cold by the time it got to the table.
Absolutely loved this place! Excellent food choices and drinks. Had the sweet potato chilaquiles and they were delightful!

I understand what flora is. I understand what fauna is. What I don’t understand is any connection to this restaurant. The theme and atmosphere feels thrown together from leftovers of River North restaurants/clubs past. The food? Meh. Nothing of note, most of the dishes felt like what was served all around the neighborhood- “inventive” dishes that mash cultures for no particular reason. Go anywhere else.
Amazing! Food, flavors, service and ambiance did not disappoint.
Noice
Omg the brunch here is so delicious. I will definitely be back!

Flora Fauna has all the makings of a potentially hit restaurant on paper - cool new atmosphere and decor, weekend mimosa service, and interesting cuisine. However, our visit today left us confused and disappointed. At various times, we were told the bar tender didn’t want to have people order beer because “they were overwhelmed” with people not ordering the mimosa service (the restaurant was not full or even to capacity - and beer seems like the easiest drink to pour (?)); our food was overpriced and very slow - not filling for the price and we waited over an hour for the cold plates; and, in general, both the waitstaff and other team members seemed completely disoriented and overwhelmed despite the restaurant being barely busy. I hope they find their footing to be the destination they could be, but I doubt I will be returning.
Thank you John and Adam for making our last night in town amazing. This place is so perfect. Flavors for days and top notch service. Would suggest this for anyone and most definitely coming again.
Fantastic food and service. I cannot get over the ambiance and the absolute quality of the food. Best bang for my buck while in Chicago 👍
Excellent food! Steak and eggs is so good. The plantain is amazing.

I liked the atmosphere and the design of the place to the most part. However there were a few things that left me confused during brunch time last Sunday:  - no choice of fresh squeezed juices, - no iced tea whatsoever (meaning no Arnold Palmer option for a drink) - two choices of hot tea, which didn't include black tea (only green and chamomile). Afterwards we found out it cost $7 for one cup of it (wasn't offered any extra water) without any "embellishments" that could make it worth it - just regular Bigelow tea bag in a mug, without honey, lemon or anything else that could justify the price - no egg on a avocado toast, which was just dry - also fried plaintains as a side were bland and hard to even bite  I very much enjoyed their French toast with berries, citrus salad and Run Vanilla sauce. That was the best part of the whole experience, even though I had to order it because I couldn't enjoy their steak and egg. That just wasn't my cup of tea.  Seems like this place more suitable for those who prefer to drink alcohol during brunch time. "Create your own cocktail" I'm sure pleases well that kind of crowd.

*Lamb Lollipops* **Jerk Chicken Sliders** ***Pork Shank Fried Rice***  Just landed in Chicago and this was the first food stop. Came in late night and the lighting and atmosphere was perfectly inviting. The folks that were helping us were so attentive and spot on. We ordered some of everything and shared. The civiche was so fresh and the Brussel Sprouts had an amazing sauce on them. But the winners of the night were definitely the three mentioned at the top. Do yourself a favor and don't sleep on the fried rice section at the bottom right back section of the. The tres leeches was fire too. Chef John even came out and made sure our pork Shank was being prepared table side correctly.  If I lived in Chicago this would for sure be a date spot for me.
Went here for brunch. Nice atmosphere and good service. Unfortunately, the food looks better then what it tastes. Maybe I was expecting more, so I was a bit disappointed 😔.
Great atmosphere, delicious food with healthy and diet conscious options

(Translated by Google) Very nice restaurant which presents itself as a trendy place offering healthy cuisine. And, they keep their promise! The welcome is friendly, the service quality and with a smile (which is becoming rare these days). Reduced, but varied menu, mainly with healthy food. Whatever your preferences; I am sure you will find a dish that makes you happy. Beef, poultry, shrimp, crustacean; There is something for every taste ! The cocktails are also super good! Without a doubt a place that I recommend to all gourmets!  (Original) Très chouette restaurant qui se présente comme un endroit trendy offrant de la cuisine saine. Et, ils tiennent bien leur promesse ! L'accueil est amical, le service de qualité et avec le sourire (ce qui devient rare de nos jours). Carte réduite, mais variée avec essentiellement des aliments sains. Peu importe vos préférences ; je suis sûr que vous trouverez un plat qui vous fait plaisir. Bœuf, volaille, crevette, crustacé ; il y en a pour tous les goûts ! Les cocktails sont eux aussi super bon ! Sans nulle doute un endroit que je conseille à tous les fins gourmets !
Good food, drinks, and service
It wasn't busy when we arrived at 11 but filled up quickly after noon. The toast was great and the food was wonderful, loaded fries were a nice spicy variety of flavors.
Nice ambiance with very creative menu. The Elote cakes where the best item we had.
Service is ok. Food hit or miss. Decor is awesome. Atmosphere great

Wonderful addition to River North. Amazing date night spot, just the right amount of action in a comfortable environment. The cocktail list is equal parts approachable and creative, and if you just wanna drink here that's fine but if you don't get the pork shank fried rice you're missing out. Elote cakes also should be mentioned. Go bring a date and get some great unique food with excellent service
Flora Fauna is a lovely little spot with beautiful atmosphere, friendly and kind staff, and excellent food! 10/10 would recommend the loaded sweet potato fries. I was delighted with my visit. 😁
Remarkable food and service!  So many great options for vegans and vegetarians. The jackfruit dan dan noodles are a must! Portions are shareable but good sized.
Restored my faith in restaurants!

Plenty of vegan, vegetarian, and "normal" options. Good ambiance, reasonable portions, and nice flavor. Service felt clunky and disjointed but not irredeemable. Orders several vegan options from the "Flora" section and some ingredients we're repeated more than I would have expected. Overall, worth the trip, but maybe not a repeat spot, unless they change the menu up. Give the Butternut Squash dish a try!
A beautiful tropical oasis in the heart of Chicago. Great atmosphere, decor and super yummy food.
High end, out of the ordinary cocktails. Hot pots are perfect for winter!

One of the best and most unique dining experiences I've had in Chicago!  Loved everything we ordered. The elote cakes were my personal fave - I'm an elote fan to begin with but the delightfully unique crunch and flavor provided a fresh take on the dish that was especially memorable.The jackfruit dandan had the perfect combination of sweet and spice. The lamb tartare was creamy and savory. The drinks were an excellent complement to the food (esp the pineapple old-fashioned) and the tres leches a fantastic finale to the meal.  The fusion of so many flavors executed perfectly makes Flora Fauna a top spot for me in Chicago.

This place was amazing. Beautifully decorated to make you feel like your in a tropical oasis with greenery everywhere and just the right amount of lighting. The cocktails were delicious and unique. The food was absolutely delicious. Such a great way to fuse cuisines from all around the world. My favorite was their take on the Mexican street corn and the octopus. Also had a stone pot that was also delicious. I would highly recommend for a date night or girls night out. This place doesn’t disappoint.
Our experience was great! We had a wonderful waitress who made our evening. It's been over a month and I still can't get the seared octopus. Holy moly, one of the top dishes I've had in Chicago.
Great when the windows were opened to the street, before that incredible hot in the place.  Drinks were good and creative.  Appetizers were good.
The pork fried rice is the tastiest, softest, melt in your mouth dish on the menu. On the other hand, I wouldn't recommend the vegetarian options.

I brought my friend here to celebrate her birthday and unfortunately was disappointed by the service. The food was good and amazing dessert but the service could of made up for it to have a better dining experience. The restaurant wasn’t too busy and our table wasn’t fully cleared before dessert was brought out - dirty knifes, drink glasses, bits of food and menus all stayed on the table and weren’t cleaned up (even after I moved everything to one end of the table) at all even after the dessert plate was taken away. The restaurant was pretty empty and the staff seemed more content on hanging out in the back versus cleaning up.

Incredible food with great vegetarian selection. The Dan Dan noodles were amazing highly recommended. We stopped in there for drinks after dinner and had a few small plates to share, but wish we had come here for dinner instead.

The service is excellent! Was greeted at every step of the meal. My family felt so welcomed.  The desserts were beautifully decorated with edible flowers.  The courses had so many surprises and kept us in suspense with flavors.  The appetisers are large enough to share.  The great care in presentation of every dish with authentic blend of flavors with modern tones is what makes it unique and worth visiting again.  Staff is generous, fantastic, patient, friendly and interactive well with everyone.
Everything was delicious and flavorful. Would definitely recommend.  The cocktails are all pretty amazing as well!

I've been here twice, and I'll be honest, I cannot WAIT to go back. The menu is a bit on the small side, but everything is seriously amazing. So many vegetarian options and it's very dietary-restriction-friendly (I have a gluten allergy and everything except the fried mushrooms and seafood fritters is gluten free! When does that happen!?).  The staff is super knowledgeable with questions about the food, as well, which I always appreciate.  The decor is amazing (even the bathrooms!), and even though (I think) it's a tiny bit on the expensive side, it's worth every penny.  I think the pineapple old fashioned is my favorite drink that I've had so far, but the choose-your-own-adventure cocktail situation is great, too. You can tell they use super fresh ingredients and none of the drinks have ever been super/overly sweet.  There are a few larger booths that would be great for groups, and a bunch of bar seating (with really comfy chairs!) that would be great for a date. If you're in the area and looking for something a little different, I couldn't recommend this place more!

I really dig this place the atmosphere and decor is clean, but fun. Loved sitting by the window, so many fun drinks to choose from. We got the pineapple old fashion. Not too sweet, if that's what you're looking for. If you're near by i recommended this place for sure.

Great new spot in River North. We've eaten here twice so far, and I think this place will be around for a while. Everything we've tried so far has been fantastic, and I love that there are so many "flora" options to choose from.  Decor is fun, drinks are tasty, and we noticed that service was better the second time through, which is what you hope to see with a new place. I would definitely recommend Flora Fauna if you're looking for a new River North option.

Loved it! The menu is amazing - both the food and cocktails. We’ve been looking for a cozy spot in River North to make our go-to for dinner and drinks and we’ve finally found it. Looking forward to going back!
Amazing!!!  The food was wonderful and the service was exceptional!!!
Good place, nice atmosphere.  The food was tasty and the drinks were ok.  Only issue, for a place called Flora Fauna there were only like 5 vegetarian meals and none of the plants were real.
good, tasty, flavor-filled veg options
Beautiful decor, small yet bold menu and overall enjoyable atmosphere. Nice change for the space!

Great concept. Southeast Asia meets Latin / South America. Big plates are basically family style (for 2) and smaller plates are shareable and knock it out of the park all together. Huge flavor forward. For those of you of a certain age the “Choose your own adventure” on cocktails is another great concept. If you are lucky enough to get Adam as a server, he tells a great story of the owners and menu. Run don’t walk to this place.

The food and atmosphere was absolutely amazing. The yams and seafood hotpot were especially tasty. My girlfriend and I weren't the biggest fan of the lamb tartare, however. Perhaps we weren't accustomed to that taste? Definitely check it out, the food is Instagram-worthy!
Great vibe, drinks and cocktails! A great place to enjoy the warm weather in Chicago but also will be an escape from the winter!!

(Translated by Google) Stayed here last week and I am completely thrilled. The ambience is very nice, the menu is small but fine, the food is made with much skill and more love, the drinks are also very interesting and leave nothing to be desired. The team is young and innovative ... but most of all very professional. I can only recommend this restaurant!  (Original) War hier letzte Woche und ich bin restlos begeistert. Das Ambiente ist sehr schön, die Speisekarte ist klein aber fein, die Speisen werden mit viel Können und noch mehr Liebe gemacht, die Getränke sind auch sehr interessant und lassen keine Wünsche offen. Das Team ist jung und innovativ... vor allem aber sehr professionell. Ich kann dieses Restaurant nur weiterempfehlen!

First the Decour was amazing. Makes you feel like you’re on vacation and not downtown Chicago. The cocktails were beyond interesting. The fact that you can pick and choose what ingredients you would like was definitely different yet very tasty. The food was ridiculously good! The octopus is one of the greatest dishes ever!  The only thing that was missing was a bread basket so I could soak up the remaining sauce. It is really that good. Elote cakes were great. The Tamarind-glazed turkey wing was absolutely delicious. The  jerk pork shank was so tender and ripe with flavor I would highly recommend.  The service was spectacular as well. Overall, highly, highly recommend Flora Fauna. We will definitely be going back.
Food is good. But service was terrible. Our server didn’t walk over for the first 20 minutes after we sat down. The server had a drink mix up. And never brought the correct utensils for our order.
Had only been open a month when we went, but the food was amazing and the service was great. Fun, inventive flavor combinations. Each dish tasted unique but complimented each other well!

This place is great!! The cocktails are amazing. Top two have to be a pineapple old fashioned and a guava margarita. So well made! You basically get to choose your own adventure by picking a liquor, a spice and a fruit. The possibilities are endless! This place is like a little vacation. When you walk in you're transported away from Illinois to someplace warm, tropical and exotic. The decor is very thoughtful even in the bathrooms. The top two favorite dishes so far are the mushrooms and the seafood fritters. The sauces are amazing!! Ask for extra sauce. You'll want it even if you just eat it with a spoon. Also, anyplace that names their dessert after Miami Vice is all right with me!

Crazy that we could get in without a reservation on a Friday! Because it’s brand new! The food is amazing and we have been here twice already in 1 week. It’s def pricey but worth it. So fresh and delicious 😋 This is the Seafood daquari...
Amazing food. Ordered everything from the Flora menu and one was better than the next. Order extra corn fritters. You won’t be upset! Will be back here ASAP.

This is one of my new favorite restaurants in Chicago, and one of the best meals I've ever had. Everything  was delicious, and the flavors although different, perfectly complimented each other to elevate the dishes. My overall favorite dish was the Seafood Fritters which found the perfect textural balance of crunchy exterior paired with a light, fluffy interior and the curry sauce was the perfect accompaniment. I recommend Flora Fauna without hesitation to anyone who is looking for a creative, accessible culinary experience.
low key incredible place for vegetarians/vegans
Amazing food, great service. A cool new twist to food!

New place. Had a glass of wine with a friend. Ordered takeout squid. Had to relevise original rating... it's delicious. Looks sad, but so yummy.  Plus, the place smells heavenly of spices. Must recommend and return.

First time here tonight and everything was great! Definitely try the Turkey Wing, the glaze on it is delicious. Had two “Choose your Own Adventure” Cocktails and both were nicely balanced. Will come back again!

Went here on a double date last weekend and absolutely loved it! The vibe in the restaurant is so fun and tropical, the food was fun and interactive, the drinks were amazing and I can't wait to take more groups of friends there! Chicago definitely needed a restaurant like this.
Good people doing good things!

Had an absolutely phenomenal meal here last night. Our waiter Adam was extremely helpful, taking the time to explain the entire menu and describe each dish as it was presented to us. There were a great amount of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options alike.  I ordered the banana mango turmeric cocktail but made it non-alcoholic. The turmeric added a lot of spice to an otherwise fruity drink.  My girlfriend and I shared the lamb tartare, elote corn cakes, and butternut squash for our main meal. All were delicious, though the lamb tartare was easily our favorite. The green apple slices added a nice hint of citrus to complement the meat.  We ended the meal on the banana split, which was also a knockout. The mint leaves were an interesting addition but definitely meshed well with the horchata ice cream. Be forewarned: we took it upon ourselves to finish the dish, but this was definitely meant for at least 4 people.  Overall I loved my meal here and will be sure to return!
